content: Do you know any jokes about knights and tables?

I've got one for you! Why don't knights ever play hide and seek?

Because good luck hiding with all that clanky armor! But wait, there's more! Why did the knight break up with his girlfriend?

Because he found out she was just going through a phase—she was only into him for his armor! Haha, get it? Armor and phases? Alright, maybe that one was a bit of a stretch.

Here's another one: Why did the knight bring a ladder to the table?

Because he heard it was a high-table! Oh, that's a bad one, isn't it? I should come up with better jokes. Maybe something about knights and round tables.

Okay, try this: Why did King Arthur bring a ladder to the round table meetings?

Because he wanted to add some height to the discussions! Hmm, still not great. Let me think differently.

What if I told you a joke about a knight who couldn't sit at the round table? Why couldn't he sit at the round table?

Because he was square! Okay, that's a classic, but maybe you've heard it before.

Let me try to make it more interesting. Imagine a knight named Sir Lancelot going to a modern-day café and trying to sit at a round table covered in glass. What happens?

He tries to pull out the chair, but since it's a glass table, he can't see the legs and knocks everything over! The other knights laugh at him, but then they realize they're all wearing shiny armor and reflect the light, making it hard to see the table legs too. So, they all end up knocking over chairs and spilling drinks. In the end, they decide to have their meetings in a well-lit room with clear table edges. Phew, that was messy!

Alright, enough of that. Do you have any other topics you'd like to joke about? Maybe something less medieval?
